oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Women sing this song of the Star !gaunu. It asks if the ||garraken flower is open and sings that the â‰ ku yam is the one that opens. 1) p.5667v: Dia!kwain heard this from his paternal grandmother (Ttuobbo-ken !kauk'si), 2) See also Stars and Flowers and !gaunu and The great star !gaunu, which singing named the stars, 3) This story is found in Book V-21.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A song sung by the star !gaunu, especially by the Bushman women
